Cris Taniguti (she/her)

Hello! Welcome to my personal webpage! Here, I present my blog and an overview of my professional profile. I am a Ph.D. in Genetics in Plant Breeding. My research has focused on statistical genetics, computational biology, and polyploid species. I am from Brazil, but I currently live in College Station (Texas, US) where I am a postdoctoral research associate at Texas A&M University. Outside of work, I love art performances and I have already performed aerial silk and other circus activities on streets, in theaters, and in open TV events.

COMPUTATIONAL TOOLS

2017 – Developing

OneMap
Analysis of molecular marker data from model (backcrosses, F2 and recombinant inbred lines) and non-model systems (i. e. outcrossing species)

×

2017 – Developing

OneMap

Linkage maps in diploid outcrossing species

Analysis of molecular marker data from model (backcrosses, F2 and recombinant inbred lines) and non-model systems (i. e. outcrossing species)
1. Didactic vignettes
  • How to build a linkage map for outcrossing populations
  • How to build a linkage map for inbred-bases populations (F2, RIL and BC)
    • 2. Input data
  • MAPMAKER format
  • OneMap format
  • VCF format
    • 3. Map quality diagnostic graphics
    4. Parents and progeny haplotyping

    2022 – Developing

    VIEWpoly
    Provides a graphical user interface to integrate, visualize and explore results from linkage and quantitative trait loci analysis, together with genomic information for autopolyploid species.

    ×

    2022 – Developing

    VIEWpoly

    A Shiny App to Visualize Genetic Maps and QTL Analysis in Polyploid Species

    Provides a graphical user interface to integrate, visualize and explore results from linkage and quantitative trait loci analysis, together with genomic information for autopolyploid species.
    1. Didactic tutorials
  • Tutorial video
  • Tutorial
  • Contributing Guidelines
    • 2. Input data
  • MAPpoly output
  • polymapR output
  • polyqtlR output
  • QTLpoly output
  • diaQTL output
  • CSV and TSV standard formats
  • GFF3 annonation file
  • FASTA reference genome
    • 3. QTL analysis graphics
    4. Haplotype selection
    5. Integrate QTL and genomic information
    6. Linkage map graphics and tabs

    2019 – Developing

    Reads2Map
    The pipelines are written with Workflow Description Language (WDL) and perform sequence quality control, alignment (BWA), SNP calling (GATK and freebayes), dosage calling (updog, SuperMASSA and polyRAD), and build linkage maps and haplotypes (OneMap and MAPpoly).

    ×

    2019 – Developing

    Reads2Map

    A collection of bioinformatic pipelines to build linkage map from sequencing data

    The pipelines are written with Workflow Description Language (WDL) and perform sequence quality control, alignment (BWA), SNP calling (GATK and freebayes), dosage calling (updog, SuperMASSA and polyRAD), and build linkage maps and haplotypes (OneMap and MAPpoly).
